intro: Telanthera brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian telanthera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters along the stems.
